title: Coventry back on track but Baggies in trouble - Aaron McLean's EFL takeaways
summary: Final Score pundit Aaron McLean gives his five takeaways from what we learned across the Championship, League One and League Two this weekend.

title: Arsenal stumble in draw against resilient Forest
summary: Arsenal missed the chance to extend their lead at the top of the Premier League table to nine points, with a goalless draw against a determined Nottingham Forest.

title: Ruthless Man Utd beat Man City in dream start for Carrick
summary: Michael Carrick gets off to the perfect start in his first match as interim manager for Manchester United with a two-goal derby win against Manchester City, leaving Pep Guardiola's side winless in their past four matches.

title: Wasteful Liverpool miss penalty in draw against Burnley
summary: Liverpool missed countless chances, including a Dominik Szoboszlai penalty, as a Michael Edwards equaliser grabbed Burnley an important point at Anfield.

title: Last-minute Wilson goal leaves fans booing Frank's Spurs
summary: A last-minute Callum Wilson goal gives West Ham an important three points and increases the pressure on Tottenham boss Thomas Frank.

title: Brobbey goal earns Sunderland comeback win over struggling Palace
summary: Enzo Le Fee and Brian Brobbey were on the scoresheet as Sunderland came from behind to beat Crystal Palace, who are without a win in 10 matches in all competitions.

title: Munster out of Champions Cup after loss to Castres
summary: Munster crash out of the Investec Champions Cup after losing an enthralling Pool Two encounter against Castres at Thomond Park.

title: Super-sub Nmecha wins it for Leeds in stoppage time
summary: Substitute Lukas Nmecha scores in stoppage time to give Leeds an important win against Fulham, and leave them eight points clear of the Premier League relegation zone.

title: Chelsea beat Brentford for Rosenior's first Premier League win
summary: Cole Palmer scored a penalty to secure the a for Chelsea against Brentford and give Liam Rosenior his first Premier League win as manager.

title: Toulouse inflict Sale's record loss to avoid shock exit
summary: Toulouse avoid a shock Investec Champions Cup exit by scoring 11 tries and inflicting Sale Sharks' record defeat.

title: 'I share the same frustrations as the fans' - Slot on Anfield boos
summary: Arne Slot responds after Liverpool are booed by sections of their home support in the 1-1 draw with Burnley at Anfield on Saturday.

title: Was this the day Spurs fans finally lost all faith in Frank?
summary: Was the dismal home loss to struggling West Ham the day Spurs fans finally lost all faith in head coach Thomas Frank, asks chief football writer Phil McNulty?

title: McClean makes Derry City return after leaving Wrexham
summary: Former Republic of Ireland international James McClean leaves Wrexham to return to Derry City on a multi-year-deal.

title: Jonbon takes back-to-back Clarence House Chase wins

title: Mbappe scores as Arbeloa earns first win as Real boss
